comment.body:
> [leftside](#comment_1_16dEowtNbV89NxPcDrAKkmnuXtiJVoVcDm): All mathematical equations seem to look raw html tags..!what's wrong?

Sorry, something went wrong. Fixed now!

> [geekless](#comment_1_1GooUE19488nDwG3TdkM8seYAHct4gjkq4): What is archived_before, what is it for, and how it works?

`archived_before` field can be set in `data/users/content.json` by site owner. It means "automatically delete all files which have modification date less than `archived_before`".

> [mg0](#comment_1_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): Nice post, just stopped by to state that ALSA allows to play [...]

Well, even if ALSA supports several inputs, I think I don't want to have *two* places where connections are maintained -- ALSA config and JACK controls.

> [kaaza](#comment_1_15cApprVFcr1skAkWssq5aAXKa7pDwJJve): Alternatively you can set autospawn=no on pulse's config file or use: pasuspender -- qjackctl

This particular solution doesn't apply here because I wanted the action to be reversible (i.e., if JACK doesn't start for some reason, PulseAudio will still start as usual and work directly with ALSA). Also, I still need to start pulseaudio so using pasuspender won't work (I think).
